alert.note: Alert for Jackson; Madison; Marshall (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued June 18 at 11:58PM CDT until June 19 at 12:15AM CDT by NWS Huntsville
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1215 AM CDT FOR NORTHWESTERN MARSHALL...SOUTHWESTERN JACKSON AND SOUTHEASTERN MADISON COUNTIES... At 1157 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Owens Cross Roads, or 12 miles east of Redstone Arsenal, moving northeast at 45 mph. Dime to nickel sized hail has been reported with this storm. HAZARD...Golf ball size hail and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Southern Huntsville, Owens Cross Roads, Grant, Gurley, Woodville, Pleasant Groves, Langston, Paint Rock, Lim Rock and Hampton Cove. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...OBSERVED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning.
